heisigComment: * In addition to deceased, the primitive meaning of to perish will also be used for this character.
heisigStory: A top hat hanging on a hook in the front hall, right where the deceased left it the day he died, reminds us of him and his kanji.
koohiiStory1: The top hat hanging on a hook belonged to the now deceased Charlie Chaplin.
koohiiStory2: The recently DECEASED are said to hang their hats on a hook by the door to the afterlife.
kunYomi: な.い、な.き-、ほろ.びる、ほろ.ぶ、ほろ.ぼす
readingExamples: 亡父 (ぼうふ), 亡命 (ぼうめい), 存亡 (そんぼう), 亡い (な.い)
words: lose something or someone, get rid of
